query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 In quella parte del giovanetto anno 2 che ’l sole i crin sotto l’Aquario tempra 3 e già le notti al mezzo dì sen vanno,
4 quando la brina in su la terra assempra 5 l’imagine di sua sorella bianca, 6 ma poco dura a la sua penna tempra,
7 lo villanello a cui la roba manca, 8 si leva, e guarda, e vede la campagna 9 biancheggiar tutta; ond’ ei si batte l’anca,
10 ritorna in casa, e qua e là si lagna, 11 come ’l tapin che non sa che si faccia; 12 poi riede, e la speranza ringavagna,
13 veggendo ’l mondo aver cangiata faccia 14 in poco d’ora, e prende suo vincastro 15 e fuor le pecorelle a pascer caccia.
query.result:
**English:**
1 In that part of the youthful year 2 when the sun tempers its rays under Aquarius 3 and the nights are already waning,
4 when the frost on the ground 5 resembles the image of its white sister, 6 but its pen does not last long in its temper,
7 the peasant, who lacks provisions, 8 gets up, looks out, and sees the countryside 9 all white; whereupon he beats his thigh,
10 returns home, and complains here and there, 11 like the wretch who does not know what to do; 12 then he goes out again, and regains hope,
13 seeing that the world has changed its face 14 in a short time, and he takes his crook 15 and drives his sheep out to pasture.
**Cornish:**
1 Yn rann-ma a'n vlydhen yowynk, 2 pan yw'n howl ow a-domma y'n gwall a-dann Akwari, 3 ha'n nosow ow a-hedhi dhe'n hanter-dydh,
4 pan yw'n an jelores war an nor a-sempla 5 del a'y hwor fenow gwyn, 6 mes na wra kettel dhe'y pluen hir,
7 an vilor dhe'n peb a-vynn an boos, 8 a-lever, ha'n gweles, ha'n gweles an pow 9 a-wynna oll; wosa henna ev a-dava y'n dhew,
10 a-dhedhi dhe'n chi ha'n gweles, ha'n gweles, 11 kepar ha'n den bosek na wodhvos dhe wul ober; 12 wosa henna ev a-dhedhi, ha'n gweles, ha'n gweles, 13 a-welas an bys owth omdhyski y'n fas, 14 yn skon a eur, ha'n kemer y'n garow, 15 ha'n kas dhe'n deves dhe'n paska.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Le braccia aperse, dopo alcun consiglio 23 eletto seco riguardando prima 24 ben la ruina, e diedemi di piglio.
query.result:
**English:**
22 He opened his arms, after some deliberation 23 with himself, first examining carefully 24 the ruin, and seized me.
**Cornish:**
22 Y'n bregh a-gorras, wosa henna ev a-wra gonis 23 gans y honan, ow a-welli kyns 24 an fordh-hwedhel, ha'n kemer dhe'n-nans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 E come quei ch’adopera ed estima, 26 che sempre par che ’nnanzi si proveggia, 27 così, levando me sù ver’ la cima
28 d’un ronchione, avvisava un’altra scheggia 29 dicendo: «Sovra quella poi t’aggrappa; 30 ma tenta pria s’è tal ch’ella ti reggia».
query.result:
**English:**
25 And like one who works and thinks, 26 who always seems to be providing for what is to come, 27 so, lifting me up towards the top
28 of a large rock, he pointed out another fragment, 29 saying: "Climb onto that one next; 30 but first test it to see if it will hold you."
**Cornish:**
25 Ha kepar ha neb ow a-ober ha ow a-beri, 26 ow a-semper ow a-wra ow a-welli kyns, 27 kepar-na, ow a-lever dhe'n-nans dhe-ves
28 unn garrek meur, ev a-welas unn aral aral, 29 ow a-leverel: "War-nans-na wosa henna hwi a-wra dhe'n-nans; 30 mes provia kyns mar yw hi kepar hag a-wra dhe'n-nans."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Non era via da vestito di cappa, 32 ché noi a pena, ei lieve e io sospinto, 33 potavam sù montar di chiappa in chiappa.
query.result:
**English:**
31 It was not a path for one dressed in a robe, 32 for we, he lightly and I pushed forward, 33 could barely manage to climb from crag to crag.
**Cornish:**
31 Nyns oedh fordh rag onan gwiskes yn kappen, 32 rag nyn, ef avel ha my a wrukkes, 33 a alla bos mar dha vos dhe vos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E se non fosse che da quel precinto 35 più che da l’altro era la costa corta, 36 non so di lui, ma io sarei ben vinto.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And if it were not that from that boundary 35 the slope was shorter than on the other side, 36 I do not know about him, but I would have been defeated.
**Cornish:**
34 Ha na vossy dhe'gas onan termen 35 moy ages onan aral oedh an fordh, 36 ny wodhvyn ef a-dro dhe'n, mes my a veu gorfenys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Ma perché Malebolge inver’ la porta 38 del bassissimo pozzo tutta pende, 39 lo sito di ciascuna valle porta
40 che l’una costa surge e l’altra scende; 41 noi pur venimmo al fine in su la punta 42 onde l’ultima pietra si scoscende.
query.result:
**English:**
37 But because Malebolge hangs upside down 38 from the gate of the lowest pit, 39 the location of each valley causes
40 one slope to rise and the other to descend; 41 we nevertheless came at last to the point 42 where the final stone juts out.
**Cornish:**
37 Mes rag Malebolge a-dro dhe'n fordh 38 a'n pow ben ughella oll a omwisk, 39 an le powysi a bub onan glyn
40 ow kul an onan fordh ha'n aral ow tisken; 41 nyn a dheuth dhe'n diwedh dhe'n fordh 42 le may an men ughella diwettha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 La lena m’era del polmon sì munta 44 quand’ io fui sù, ch’i’ non potea più oltre, 45 anzi m’assisi ne la prima giunta.
query.result:
**English:**
43 My breath was so exhausted from my lungs 44 when I reached the top that I could go no further, 45 but instead sat down as soon as I arrived.
**Cornish:**
44 Analan oen a veu dhe'n polmonow vyth 45 pan veu vy dhe'n ughella, na alla bos moy, 46 mes yn le eneth vy dhe'n kynsa fordh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E però leva sù; vinci l’ambascia 53 con l’animo che vince ogne battaglia, 54 se col suo grave corpo non s’accascia.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And therefore rise up; overcome the anguish 53 with the spirit that conquers every battle, 54 if it does not collapse with its heavy body.
**Cornish:**
52 Ha lemmyn sevel; gorfen an gwella 53 gans an sperys a wra gorfen pub brons, 54 mar ny wra kovelles gans y gorf pysk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Più lunga scala convien che si saglia; 56 non basta da costoro esser partito. 57 Se tu mi ’ntendi, or fa sì che ti vaglia».
query.result:
**English:**
55 A longer stairway must be climbed; 56 it is not enough to have departed from these. 57 If you understand me, now make it be of use to you.”
**Cornish:**
55 Skell hirra moy dhe vos dhe'n fordh, 56 nyns yw dos dhe vos dhe vos dhe'n ayr. 57 Mar t'ew komprehendya vy, gwrewgh henna dhe vos dhe'n gweres.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Leva’mi allor, mostrandomi fornito 59 meglio di lena ch’i’ non mi sentia, 60 e dissi: «Va, ch’i’ son forte e ardito».
query.result:
**English:**
58 He lifted me up then, showing me to be furnished 59 with more breath than I felt I had, 60 and said: “Go, for I am strong and bold.”
**Cornish:**
58 Ev a'm sevelsa, ow tiskwedha vy 59 moy a-les analan ages vy a-sensya, 60 ha leveris: “Dos, rag vy yw kalet ha grow.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Su per lo scoglio prendemmo la via, 62 ch’era ronchioso, stretto e malagevole, 63 ed erto più assai che quel di pria.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Up over the cliff we took our way, 62 which was rough, narrow, and difficult to travel, 63 and steeper by far than the one before.**
**Cornish:**
61 Wartha'gan an garrek ny kemer an fordh, 62 hag ev o ros, keyn ha'gas dowr, 63 ha ughella ages an onan kyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Parlando andava per non parer fievole; 65 onde una voce uscì de l’altro fosso, 66 a parole formar disconvenevole.
query.result:
**English:**
64 He spoke as he walked, so as not to seem weak; 65 whereupon a voice came from the other ditch, 66 uttering words unsuited to forming speech.**
**Cornish:**
64 Ev a gomera orth y feutryaga gwan, 65 rag ens ow ton a-dhyworthas a'n foss arall, 66 orth gerow treus dhe furvya gerel gansow.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Non so che disse, ancor che sovra ’l dosso 68 fossi de l’arco già che varca quivi; 69 ma chi parlava ad ire parea mosso.
query.result:
**English:**
67 I do not know what he said, although I was already 68 on the ridge of the arch that spans the chasm there; 69 but whoever was speaking seemed moved to anger.**
**Cornish:**
67 Ny wodhav pyth a leveris, erbyn o'n nessa 68 ow tos an arc'h a dreus an dowr ena, 69 mes an neb a gomera a semla gorra.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Io era vòlto in giù, ma li occhi vivi 71 non poteano ire al fondo per lo scuro; 72 per ch’io: «Maestro, fa che tu arrivi
73 da l’altro cinghio e dismontiam lo muro; 74 ché, com’ i’ odo quinci e non intendo, 75 così giù veggio e neente affiguro».
query.result:
**English:**
70 I was turned downwards, but my keen eyes 71 could not reach the bottom because of the darkness; 72 therefore I said: "Master, make sure you reach
73 the other bank and let us descend the wall; 74 for, just as I hear from here but do not understand, 75 so too I see down there but make out nothing."**
**Cornish:**
70 O'm troys o-woles, mes ow lagha byw 71 ny alla ow pos dhe'n fordh rag an tywyll; 72 rag henna: "Mester, mara dos dhe'n fordh
73 a'n nessa kyns ha diskenn an wal; 74 rag, kepar ha klevav owth ena ha ny wodhav, 75 kepar henna gweles owth ena ha ny wodhav dim."**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 «Altra risposta», disse, «non ti rendo 77 se non lo far; ché la dimanda onesta 78 si de’ seguir con l’opera tacendo».
query.result:
**English:**
76 "I will give you no other answer," he said, 77 "than to do it; for an honest request 78 should be followed by action, not words."**
**Cornish:**
76 "Neb areth," ev a leveris, "ny wra vyth dhys, 77 mes an gwul; rag an gows gwir a wra dhe'n fordh 78 gans ober orth heb ger."**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Noi discendemmo il ponte da la testa 80 dove s’aggiugne con l’ottava ripa, 81 e poi mi fu la bolgia manifesta:
82 e vidivi entro terribile stipa 83 di serpenti, e di sì diversa mena 84 che la memoria il sangue ancor mi scipa.
query.result:
**English:**
79 We descended the bridge from the head 80 where it joins with the eighth bank, 81 and then the pit was revealed to me:
82 and within I saw a fearsome throng 83 of serpents, and of such diverse kinds 84 that the memory of it still chills my blood.**
**Cornish:**
79 Ny diskennas an pons a'n penn 80 le may junya gans an ethves renk, 81 ha wosa henna an bolgia kler:
82 ha'm gwelas ena stipa ow tynner 83 a sarfow, ha a henna sort avel 84 wosa'n kov a wra'm goel gans gwav.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Più non si vanti Libia con sua rena; 86 ché se chelidri, iaculi e faree 87 produce, e cencri con anfisibena,
88 né tante pestilenzie né sì ree 89 mostrò già mai con tutta l’Etïopia 90 né con ciò che di sopra al Mar Rosso èe.
query.result:
**English:**
85 Let Libya no longer boast of its sands; 86 for though it produces vipers, adders, and horned vipers, 87 and cerastes with amphisbaenas,
88 never did it display so many or such deadly plagues, 89 not even all of Ethiopia 90 or the lands that lie beyond the Red Sea.**
**Cornish:**
85 Ny wra Libia moy bostya gans y gorsen; 86 rag gensi chelidri, iaculi ha faree 87 a wra gwrys, ha cencri gans anfisibena,
88 ny wra kemmys avel avel marow 89 a wra gwrys gensi Ethiopa oll 90 po an gwlasow a wra wartha'n Mor Rudh.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Tra questa cruda e tristissima copia 92 corrëan genti nude e spaventate, 93 sanza sperar pertugio o elitropia:
94 con serpi le man dietro avean legate; 95 quelle ficcavan per le ren la coda 96 e ’l capo, ed eran dinanzi aggroppate.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Among this cruel and fearsome throng 92 ran naked and terrified people, 93 with no hope of refuge or heliotrope:
94 their hands were bound behind their backs with snakes; 95 the snakes thrust their tails and heads through their loins, 96 and their heads were knotted in front.**
**Cornish:**
91 Ynter an copia crud ha trysthys 92 a redya pobel noeth ha ow aveyth, 93 heb gwell sperans rag pertugio po elitropia:
94 gans sarfow o'n dhew a-dhyworth o'n nessa; 95 henna a ficca ow codhow ha'n pennow dre'n dowr, 96 ha'n pennow o'n nessa o'n nessa o'n nessa.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Ed ecco a un ch’era da nostra proda, 98 s’avventò un serpente che ’l trafisse 99 là dove ’l collo a le spalle s’annoda.
query.result:
**English:**
97 And behold, a serpent darted at one who was on our side, 98 and pierced him where the neck joins the shoulders.**
**Cornish:**
97 Ha, weles, dhe unn o'n nessa fordh, 98 ow tos sarf orth hag ev a'n traffis 99 le may jun an dowr ha'n scovar a wra junys.**

**English:**
100 Never was O or I written so quickly, 101 as he caught fire and burned, and had to fall 102 and become ash;
103 and after he was destroyed on the ground, 104 the dust gathered itself together 105 and suddenly returned to its former state.**
**Cornish:**
100 Nyns o po O po I skrifys mar dha veur, 101 kepar ev a enys ha'n tan ha'n losow oll 102 a wra dhe'n fordh ha mos ha bos.**
103 Ha wosa henna a wra distruys wartha'n dor, 104 an polva a junyas rag y honan 105 ha'n henna sort a wra dhe'n fordh orth pub.**

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 E qual è quel che cade, e non sa como, 113 per forza di demon ch’a terra il tira, 114 o d’altra oppilazion che lega l’omo,
115 quando si leva, che ’ntorno si mira 116 tutto smarrito de la grande angoscia 117 ch’elli ha sofferta, e guardando sospira:
118 tal era ’l peccator levato poscia.
query.result:
**English:**
112 And just as one who falls and knows not how, 113 through force of a demon that drags him to the ground, 114 or from some other impediment that binds a man,
115 when he rises, looks around himself, 116 utterly bewildered by the great anguish 117 that he has suffered, and sighs as he looks:
118 such was the sinner, risen up afterwards.
**Cornish:**
112 Ha keth yw henna a wra dhegwedhes, ha na wodho, 113 dre dreys a dhiamon a wra’n gul dhe’n dor, 114 po dhe’n lettyans aral a wra keth an den,
115 pan wra sevel, a wra gulwel dhe-dro, 116 oll gollet a’n angos bras 117 a wra dhe-gowsys, ha golwel a wra sevel:
118 keth o an pechyor sevel wosa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
119 Oh potenza di Dio, quant’ è severa, 120 che cotai colpi per vendetta croscia!
121 Lo duca il domandò poi chi ello era; 122 per ch’ei rispuose: «Io piovvi di Toscana, 123 poco tempo è, in questa gola fiera.
query.result:
**English:**
119 Oh power of God, how severe it is, 120 that it rains down such blows in vengeance!
121 The leader then asked him who he was; 122 to which he replied: "I fell from Tuscany, 123 a short time ago, into this fierce pit.
**Cornish:**
119 Oh gallu Duw, pyth yw fethys, 120 a wra’n keth colpow magh dhe venjans!
121 An dywghor a vynnasas ena wosa pyw o, 122 rag ena a leveris: “My a wra kodha a Tuskani, 123 termyn byghan yw, dhe’n gulma magh magh.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Vita bestial mi piacque e non umana, 125 sì come a mul ch’i’ fui; son Vanni Fucci 126 bestia, e Pistoia mi fu degna tana».
query.result:
**English:**
124 I took pleasure in a bestial life, not a human one, 125 just like the mule that I was; I am Vanni Fucci, 126 a beast, and Pistoia was my fitting lair.
**Cornish:**
124 Bew bywhestek a garas vy ha na denel, 125 keth mul o vy; my a wra Vanni Fucci 126 best, ha Pistoia o vea vy aga tan.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 E ïo al duca: «Dilli che non mucci, 128 e domanda che colpa qua giù ’l pinse; 129 ch’io ’l vidi uomo di sangue e di crucci».
query.result:
**English:**
127 And I to the leader: "Tell him not to hide himself, 128 and ask what fault thrust him down here; 129 for I knew him to be a man of blood and strife."
**Cornish:**
127 Ha my dhe’n dywghor: “Lever dhyso na wra kov, 128 ha govyn pyw peth pechas a wra’n gul dhe-nans; 129 rag my a welas ena den a woos ha krus.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Io non posso negar quel che tu chiedi; 137 in giù son messo tanto perch’ io fui 138 ladro a la sagrestia d’i belli arredi,
139 e falsamente già fu apposto altrui.
query.result:
**English:**
136 I cannot deny what you ask; 137 I am placed down here because I was 138 a thief of the beautiful furnishings of the sacristy,
139 and the blame was falsely placed on someone else.
**Cornish:**
136 My na allaw henna a wra’th ow houl, 137 y’n-nans vyf posys kemmys rag my a vea 138 lader dhe’n sagrestia a’n arghans pryssyow,
139 ha gelvinek o vea posys dhe den aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
140 Ma perché di tal vista tu non godi, 141 se mai sarai di fuor da’ luoghi bui,
142 apri li orecchi al mio annunzio, e odi.
query.result:
**English:**
140 But so that you may not enjoy such a sight, 141 if ever you should emerge from these dark places,
142 open your ears to my announcement and listen.
**Cornish:**
140 Mes rag na wra’th ow garas a’n welas, 141 po byth vyth ow a wra a-ves a’n leow tywyll,
142 gor dhe’n klow dhe’m kelm, ha klev.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
151 E detto l’ho perché doler ti debbia!».
query.result:
**English:**
151 And I have said this so that you may grieve for it!”.
**Cornish:**
151 Ha my a leveris henna rag owth ow a wra gollet dool rag ena!”.
